snippet.title: New-look Nelson Bay Golf Club open | photos, video

New-look Nelson Bay Golf Club open | photos, video
CHEERS: Nelson Bay Golf Club general manager Trevor Harrison and captain Peter Power celebrate the opening of the new clubhouse on Thursday, August 3.
The main entry and new carpark.

The side of the clubhouse is one of the first things you see when your drive into the carpark. The balcony is for the function room, which is where reception used to be in the old building.

"Worth the wait" was the general consensus punters visiting Nelson Bay Golf Club had when asked what they thought of the new-look clubhouse on Thursday. The doors to the building opened at noon on August 3.
Soon after, members and guests interested in seeing the new facilities began streaming in.
There were smiles on the faces of many members who felt the loss of the building when it burned down on Father's Day in 2015 and anticipation during the past 23 months while waiting for the new clubhouse to be built.
Craig Burnett, a member for 14 years, said the new clubhouse is "brilliant". He enjoyed a drink in the TAB area of the club with friends on Thursday, while technicians worked on getting the televisions in the room connected. "The caravan they set up [after the fire] served us well, but this is brilliant," he said. Friend Ken Wagner said the building is "magnificent". "We waited close to two years for this and I have to say, it is worth the wait," he said.
